alert.note: Alert for Brantley; Inland Glynn; Wayne (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 11:50AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Camden, northwestern Glynn, eastern Brantley and Wayne Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1150 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Odum to near Raybon to near Hickox. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jesup, Nahunta, Gardi, Dock Junction, Screven, Odum, Thalmann, Everett, Raybon and Waynesville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for southeastern Georgia.
